Requirements: Admission to the MAcc program is competitive. Successful applicants generally meet or exceed the following qualifications: A GMAT score of 580 or higher. A minimum GPA of 3.25 in the last 60 hours of coursework. The GMAT may be waived if the student earns a 3.5 GPA in the last 60 hours of their undergraduate curriculum and a 3.5 GPA in upper-level (300-level and above) accounting coursework. The application process requires the online application, application fee, transcripts, GMAT or GRE scores, a Statement of Objectives, contact information for three references, and a resume. English proficiency scores may also be required.

Applications are accepted throughout the year on a rolling basis. When all your application materials are received, your application will be reviewed by faculty. Required documents for all degree programs (M.S., Ph.D., Ed.D.) include: Graduate School application and fee, official transcript(s) showing a 3.0 or higher GPA on the last 60 hours of credit for the bachelor's degree, a Statement of Goals and Professional Experience (one to two pages, double-spaced), a Résumé or Curriculum Vitae, and three letters of recommendation. Doctoral (Ph.D. and Ed.D.) applicants are also required to submit a Writing Sample.

To be considered for admission into the Master of Agribusiness program, you must have: A bachelor's degree from an accredited university with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale for the last 60 hours of credit. Two or more years of professional experience in an agribusiness-related field is preferred but not required. The following application materials are needed to complete your application file: An online application, Official transcripts from each college or university attended, Statement of purpose, Three letters of reference, Resume or curriculum vita.
Application requirements include a minimum 3.0 grade point average on the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework, and a bachelor's degree.
Program name: Agricultural and Extension Education and Communication

Requirements:
A four-year bachelor's degree.
An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale.
Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is NOT required for M.S. or Ph.D. applicants.
Three letters of reference from individuals who can assess your academic potential.
Statement of Objectives.
Official transcripts from each college or university attended.
Evidence of English proficiency (for non-native English speakers).

In addition to the Graduate School's application requirements, the following are required by this program: Three letters of recommendation; Statement of objectives; A graduate faculty member must agree to serve as the student's major professor before the student can be admitted to the graduate program.

A minimum 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale in the B.S. degree is required. Students with a GPA between 2.65 and 3.0 will be considered for probationary admission. Students entering the graduate program in Agronomy are expected to have a B.S. or M.S. degree in Agronomy or a closely related discipline. Students with deficiencies in their academic background may be admitted on a provisional basis and may be required to take additional coursework without graduate credit. Required documents include: a statement of objectives (1-2 pages), a resume or curriculum vitae, one official transcript from each college or university attended, and three letters of reference. GRE scores are not required. For international students, minimum English language proficiency scores are required: TOEFL (iBT) 79, PTE 58, or IELTS 6.5.

Applicants must have a D.V.M. (or equivalent) or a B.S. degree from an accredited institution. An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required. Application packets should include: Graduate School application form, Official transcripts from all institutions attended, Three letters of recommendation, A statement of objectives, A curriculum vitae (resume). International students whose native language is not English must score at least 550 on the paper-based TOEFL, 213 on the computer-based test or 79 on the internet-based test. The TSE test is also recommended.

A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution with a grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale for the last 60 hours of credit. The following must be uploaded with your online application: Statement of purpose/letter of intent stating your career goals and research interest area. Please indicate the faculty member(s) whose research program is of most interest; Resume or curriculum vitae; Three letters of reference; Official transcripts from each college or university attended. Official GRE scores are not required for admission to our graduate program. Students whose native language is not English must score a 550 or higher on the paper-based TOEFL, 213 on the computer-based test, or 79 on the internet-based test.

To apply, please complete the online application through the K-State Graduate School. You will need to upload the following materials:

A statement of purpose describing your interest in the K-State M.A. program in anthropology. Tell us about your intellectual and professional goals, and how you see our program contributing to them.

A writing sample, such as a paper submitted for a course, that demonstrates your writing and critical thinking skills. We do not have a specific length requirement.

A list of three references. The online application system will ask you for their contact information, and they will be sent a request to submit a letter of recommendation for you. Please choose people who know you well and can speak to your potential for success in a graduate program.

Transcripts from all colleges or universities you have attended. Unofficial transcripts are sufficient for the review process; official transcripts are required upon admission.

GRE scores are not required, but you may submit them if you wish.

TOEFL or IELTS scores (for non-native speakers of English). See the Graduate School's website for minimum score requirements.

An application for graduate study at Kansas State University must be submitted online through the Graduate School's application portal. A one-time non-refundable application fee is required at the time of application submission. Undergraduate Grade Point Average (GPA) of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale. Three letters of recommendation from individuals who are able to comment on the applicant's academic potential for graduate study. A letter of intent/statement of purpose (1-2 pages) describing your academic and professional goals and how the K-State AT graduate program will help you meet those goals. Official transcripts from each college or university attended. Resume or curriculum vitae. GRE scores are not required for admission. For applicants whose native language is not English, proof of English proficiency is required.

A bachelor's degree from a college or university accredited by the Cognia. A minimum 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale in the last 60 hours of your bachelor's degree coursework. Transcripts from each institution attended. Three letters of recommendation. A professional resume. A statement of objectives. A writing sample: A graded, scholarly paper from your bachelor's degree program that reflects your knowledge, skills and capacity for scholarly writing. For international students, a financial affidavit and TOEFL, IELTS or PTE scores are required.

Admission to graduate study in architectural engineering is granted by the dean of the Graduate School upon the recommendation of the department. The recommendation is based on the student's transcripts, letters of recommendation and statement of objectives. Students applying for admission to the Master of Science in architectural engineering program should have a Bachelor of Science degree in architectural engineering from an EAC/ABET accredited program or a Bachelor of Science degree in a closely related engineering field (e.g., civil engineering, electrical engineering or mechanical engineering). Students applying for admission to the Doctor of Philosophy program should have a Bachelor of Science degree in architectural engineering from an EAC/ABET accredited program and a Master of Science degree in architectural engineering or a closely related field (e.g., civil engineering, electrical engineering, or mechanical engineering). A minimum grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required for both the B.S. and M.S. degrees. The GRE is not required for admission to the ARE graduate program. International students are required to have a minimum TOEFL score of 79 on the internet-based test (iBT), or a minimum IELTS score of 6.5. This requirement can be waived if the applicant has a degree from a U.S. institution.

Application materials to be submitted online: Online application; Application fee; One official transcript from each college or university attended; English language proficiency requirements; Statement of purpose; Three letters of recommendation; Portfolio; Resume (optional). Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores are no longer required for M.Arch applicants.

An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 in the last 60 hours of coursework is required.

Application materials required:
• Graduate School application
• Application fee
• One official transcript from each college or university attended.
• Letters of recommendation: A minimum of three letters of recommendation are required. The letters should be written by individuals who are in a position to evaluate the applicant's academic and/or professional capabilities.
• Statement of purpose: Submit a letter of intent that states the student's career goals and how the MFA degree in art would help achieve those goals.
• Portfolio: The portfolio should be submitted as a single PDF or PowerPoint presentation with 20 images of recent works, a corresponding list of works, an artist statement and a résumé.

For full admission to the program, applicants must have a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution with a major in art history or the equivalent, a minimum GPA of 3.0 (on a 4.0 scale) in all undergraduate junior and senior level coursework, and at least one modern foreign language. The graduate application must include: Transcripts of all previous college coursework. Three letters of recommendation sent directly by recommenders. A statement of objectives for seeking the master's degree in art history, including the applicant's research interests. A sample of the applicant's scholarly writing, preferably a research paper on an art historical topic.

A completed online application; Application fee; One official transcript from each college or university attended; Three letters of reference are required. The reference letters will be submitted online by the referees you specify in your application.; A statement of objectives should be uploaded at the time you submit your application. It should be a concise (500-1000 word) statement telling us about your background, interests and career goals.; A curriculum vitae or resume should be uploaded at the time you submit your application.; The GRE test is not required for admission.; For international applicants, an English proficiency test score is required.

In addition to the requirements of the Graduate School, prospective students should send the following materials directly to the Biochemistry and Molecular Biophysics Graduate Program: A personal statement of career objectives; Transcripts of all previous college work; Three letters of recommendation. Graduate Record Exam (GRE) General Test scores are not required but can be included as part of a complete application package. International students must also submit a TOEFL score.

To apply, go to the Graduate School application page. In the program selection, specify 'Bioinformatics (Certificate)'. Select either campus 'Manhattan' or 'Distance Education' and then continue to follow instructions on the application form.

Required Documents:

A statement of purpose describing your motivation for pursuing the certificate, and how you see the training in bioinformatics contributing to your career goals.

Copies of transcripts from all institutions attended.

Note that the graduate school may request additional documents, such as proof of English proficiency for international students.

Students applying to the graduate program should have an undergraduate degree in engineering, physical science, or biological science from an ABET accredited program or a program of equivalent standing. Students without a degree from an ABET accredited engineering program will be required to take some undergraduate engineering courses to meet the graduation requirements of the Graduate School. The application will require: a one-to-two-page statement of objectives, three letters of recommendation, and transcripts from all colleges and universities attended. Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores are not required for admission to the BAE M.S. and Ph.D. programs. Applicants who are not native speakers of English must demonstrate competence in English.

Required Application Materials:
- Graduate School Application
- Unofficial Transcripts
- Three letters of reference
- Statement of objectives: 1-2 pages describing your motivation for graduate study, your research experience, your long-term goals, and any other information you believe is relevant to your application. Applicants should identify one or more faculty whose research is of interest.
- Curriculum Vitae (CV)
- English Language Proficiency (for international students)

The Biomedical Science Graduate Program is available to students holding a DVM, MS, BS, BA, or equivalent degree. To be considered for admission, the following materials must be submitted to the Graduate School: An online application, Official transcripts from each college or university attended, For international students, a TOEFL score (Test of English as a Foreign Language) of at least 550 (paper) or 213 (computer) or 79 (internet-based), A Statement of Objectives describing your reasons for pursuing graduate study, your particular areas of interest within the broad field of biomedical research, your career goals, and any relevant research or other experience, Three letters of reference from individuals qualified to comment on your academic and research potential. These references are submitted as part of the online application, A curriculum vitae (CV) or resume, An application fee. The GRE is not required for admission to the Biomedical Science Graduate Program.

A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.
An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale.
Transcripts from each college or university attended.
A statement of objectives.
Three letters of recommendation.
For international students, a TOEFL score of 550 (paper) or 79 (internet-based), an IELTS score of 6.5, or a PTE score of 58.

A complete application to the K-State MBA program will include: Online application and fee, Official transcripts, A current resume, Three letters of recommendation, One-page statement of purpose, A GMAT or GRE score... Official TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE score (if required).

All applicants must have completed a bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution prior to graduate study. Applicants must have a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. The following materials must be uploaded with your online application: a one- to two-page statement of objectives, three letters of recommendation, a resume or curriculum vitae, and official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. Official GRE scores are not required for admission. Official TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE scores are required for non-native English speakers.

A complete application must contain the following: The online application form available through the Graduate School website. One copy of your transcript from all previous universities. Three letters of recommendation (instructions for submitting letters are part of the on-line application process). A statement of your background and objectives in graduate study. A resume or CV. Official scores from the GRE General Exam (optional for Fall 2024 admissions). In addition to the items above, international students must demonstrate proficiency in English, as described in Chapter 1, Section F of the Graduate Handbook. This is normally demonstrated by scoring at least a 79 on the TOEFL iBT or at least a 6.5 on the IELTS.

An earned B.S. degree in civil engineering or a closely related field from an ABET-accredited program or an approved international institution. A minimum grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. GRE is not required for Fall 2024 and Spring 2025.

A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution.
A 3.0 GPA for the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework.
The K-State Graduate School application.
Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
A resume detailing all employment, campus involvement and leadership roles.
Statement of goals and experiences. Your statement should be no longer than two pages, double-spaced and should describe your reasons for pursuing a degree in student affairs; describe your goals upon degree completion; describe significant personal and professional experiences that have contributed to your personal growth and development.
Three letters of recommendation that address your academic potential for graduate study and your potential for, or experience in, college student development. It is preferred that at least two of the letters be from former professors.
Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required for admission.

The application for admission to graduate study in communication studies consists of the following materials:

- A completed application form (available online at the Graduate School Website).
- A non-refundable application fee.
- One official transcript from each college or university attended.
- Three letters of recommendation. These letters should be from individuals (preferably former professors) who are in a position to comment upon your academic abilities and potential for success in graduate school.
- A statement of objectives. This statement of 1-2 pages should detail your academic and professional objectives and indicate how graduate work in communication studies at Kansas State University will help you meet these objectives.
- A sample of scholarly writing. This sample should be a paper you have written for a class that demonstrates your ability to write a research-based paper. Please do not send a group project unless you can clearly identify your own writing in the project.
- Official GRE scores. Please have your scores sent from ETS to Kansas State University (code 6334). The Department of Communication Studies no longer uses the analytical writing section of the GRE in its decision making.
- Official TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE scores for international students whose native language is not English.
A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. A minimum 3.0 GPA on the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework.

Apply through the Graduate School application. Required documents: Unofficial transcripts from each college or university attended, Statement of Objectives, Three letters of recommendation, Curriculum Vitae/Resume. For international students: English proficiency test scores. The GRE is not required for admission to the Comparative Pathobiology Ph.D. program.

CS department requirements for M.S. and Ph.D. students: Statement of objectives: Submit a one- to two-page statement of objectives. This document must clearly state your specific interests, background, and your long-term professional goals. You may also state your preferred professors and research areas in this document. Letters of recommendation: Request three letters of recommendation to be sent from individuals who are familiar with your academic background and/or work experience. The letters must be sent by the recommenders themselves. We do not accept letters submitted by the applicant. Transcripts: Submit an official transcript from each college or university where you received your bachelor’s degree(s) and for all subsequent coursework. Resume: Submit a resume. GRE scores: The GRE requirement is currently waived. English proficiency requirement: International students must meet the Graduate School's English proficiency requirements.

Required Application Materials: A brief statement of interest (approximately 500 words), Unofficial transcripts, Resume/CV, $65 domestic application fee or $75 international application fee, English Proficiency test scores (for non-native English speakers).

An undergraduate degree from an accredited institution. A grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale. A statement of objectives of 500-1000 words. Describe your professional goals and explain how a Master's degree in Conflict Resolution from Kansas State University will help you achieve these goals. Three letters of recommendation from individuals able to comment on your academic and/or professional abilities. A writing sample of no more than ten pages that demonstrates your analytical and writing abilities. A resume/CV is not required but recommended for those with professional experience. The GRE is not required for admission.

Application to the Graduate School, which includes: A current vita/resume. A Statement of Goals and Professional Experience. Transcripts from all colleges/universities attended from which you received a bachelor's degree or any subsequent degrees. Three letters of recommendation. A writing sample. Official Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores. Kansas State University's institution code for the GRE is 6334. A master’s degree in counseling or a closely related field from an accredited institution. A graduate grade point average (GPA) of 3.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale. Evidence of professional experience in counseling or student development. An on-campus interview.

The following materials are required for application to the Master's program: Graduate School application, Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended, Statement of purpose, Vita or resume, Three letters of recommendation, and a Video submission. GRE scores are not required for admission. International students may be required to submit TOEFL scores.

The following application materials are required and must be submitted through the Graduate School application portal. For full consideration, your application materials must be received by January 8 for fall admission with financial consideration. The final deadline is March 12 for fall admission without financial consideration. Application materials include: Graduate School Application; Application Fee; Transcripts; Statement of Purpose: A one-page, single-spaced statement of your purposes and goals in seeking the M.A. in English at Kansas State University; Three Letters of Recommendation: Three letters of recommendation from former professors who are familiar with your academic work. These will be uploaded by your recommenders after you provide their contact information in the application; Creative Writing Sample: A writing sample in your chosen genre of up to 10 pages for poetry or 25 pages for fiction and nonfiction; The GRE General Test is currently waived for applications.

Applicants for the master's degree program must have a 3.0 GPA or higher in the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework. Admission may be granted with a lower GPA if other factors are sufficiently strong. Applicants to the master's program must have earned a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency.

Students must be admitted to a degree program or as a non-degree-seeking student at K-State. Students may be concurrently enrolled in an undergraduate degree program and this certificate program.

To be accepted into this program, you must:
• have a minimum GPA of 2.5
• have completed either CIS 200: Fundamentals of Information Systems or CIS 300: Data Structures and Algorithms 1

A bachelor's degree with a GPA of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 hours of coursework.
Previous coursework including calculus, statistics and computer programming. Coursework must be documented on the student's transcripts. Students who do not have documented coursework can take an exam or take the required coursework at K-State.
GRE scores are not required.
A statement of objectives.
Three letters of recommendation.
A resume or CV.

Admission Requirements:
A bachelor's degree (or equivalent) from a regionally accredited institution with a GPA of 3.0 or better on a 4.0 scale.
A D.V.M. (or equivalent) from an AVMA accredited institution.
For international students, a score of 550 (paper) or 79 (internet-based) on the TOEFL, 6.5 on the IELTS or 58 on the Pearson Test of English is required.
GRE is not required for admission.

How to Apply:
Complete the online application.
Upload the following documents:
- Statement of purpose
- Curriculum vitae or resume
- Three letters of recommendation
- Transcripts from all previous coursework

To be accepted into the master's degree in dietetics program, you must have:

- A bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution and a minimum 3.0 GPA on the last 60 hours of credit.
- A verification statement from an ACEND-accredited didactic program in dietetics (DPD).
- Been accepted into the K-State dietetic internship program OR provide a verification statement from an ACEND-accredited dietetic internship. The online master's in dietetics is not an ACEND-accredited dietetic internship.
- International students must have a minimum TOEFL score of 575 (paper), 232 (computer) or 80 (iBT); or a minimum IELTS score of 6.5.

The following must be uploaded with your application: Resume/Curriculum Vitae, Statement of purpose describing your interest in drama therapy, why you are interested in the K-State drama therapy program, and your goals for using this degree, Unofficial transcripts from all colleges/universities attended, Names and emails of 3 professional references for letters of recommendation. It is your responsibility to follow up with your references to be sure they have submitted letters before the deadline, Writing sample from a previous undergraduate or graduate course, TOEFL scores (for international students only).

Graduate School Application; Official transcripts from each institution attended; Three letters of recommendation; A statement of goals and professional experience; A resume or curriculum vitae; A writing sample (scholarly paper); For non-native English speakers, an official report of TOEFL or IELTS scores is required; GPA of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 hours of coursework.

Applications for admission to the Ph.D. program in economics at Kansas State University should be made through the Graduate School online application. The department of economics will need the following materials to review your application: Graduate School application, Official transcripts from each college or university attended, Official TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE scores (if required), Three letters of reference, Statement of objectives, A vita (or resume), Application Fee. GRE scores are optional for admission to the PhD program.

Most of our master's and doctoral programs require the following:

A bachelor's degree from a college or university accredited by the cognizant regional accrediting agency for higher education.
A minimum 3.0 grade point average (GPA) on a 4.0 scale in the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework.
Transcripts from each institution attended, including the one that awarded the bachelor's degree must be uploaded to the application.
Three letters of recommendation submitted by references who can attest to your capacity for graduate-level work.
Statement of goals/objectives detailing your professional goals and how this graduate degree will help you accomplish them.
Resume/curriculum vita outlining your educational and professional experiences.

Some programs have additional requirements such as a writing sample, specific undergraduate coursework, teaching license, or prerequisite degree. Please see the program page for a full listing of application requirements.

Admission Requirements: A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution. An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 hours of coursework. Applicants with a GPA lower than 3.0 may be considered for provisional admission. At least two years of leadership experience in a school or other educational organization. Access to a school or other educational organization to complete class-related field experiences. Application Materials: To apply, you will need to submit the following materials to the K-State Graduate School: Graduate School application, Official transcripts, Three letters of recommendation, Resume or curriculum vitae, Statement of goals and professional experience.

A GPA of 3.0 or better on a 4.0 scale for the last two years of undergraduate study is normally required for admission to both the M.S. and Ph.D. programs. The following must be submitted as part of the online application: a one-to-two-page statement of objectives, transcripts, three letters of recommendation, and a resume or curriculum vitae (CV). The GRE is not required for admission to the ECE graduate program. International applicants must also provide proof of English proficiency.

A B.S. in electrical or computer engineering from an ABET-accredited program with a GPA of 3.0 or better in the junior and senior years. Applicants with degrees in other fields such as computer science, mathematics or physics may be admitted with deficiencies.

A bachelor’s degree with a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 in the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework. Evidence of successful teaching experience and/or extensive experience with elementary children.

In addition to the Graduate School requirements, the engineering Ph.D. program requires the following:

* M.S. in engineering from an ABET-accredited program, or an M.S. in a closely related field. Exceptional students with a B.S. in engineering may be admitted directly to the Ph.D. program upon recommendation of the department and approval of the Engineering Graduate Programs Committee.
* GPA of 3.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale for M.S. degree coursework.
* Submission of a satisfactory plan of study.
* Letters of recommendation.
* Statement of objectives.
* International students whose native language is not English must demonstrate competence in the English language by scoring a minimum of 575 on the paper-based TOEFL, 90 on the internet-based TOEFL (with no part score below 20), or 7.0 on the IELTS (with no part score below 6.5).

A bachelor’s degree in engineering or a closely related field (e.g., physics, chemistry, mathematics) from an ABET accredited or equivalent program.

A minimum grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the bachelor’s degree.

A bachelor's degree with a major in English (or equivalent) and a minimum grade point average of 3.0 in upper-division coursework in the major. The GRE is not required for admission to our programs. To apply, please complete the K-State Graduate School application online. Be sure to upload all the following supplemental documents directly to your online application: Statement of Purpose: Write a 1-2 page statement of purpose outlining your preparation for graduate study in English, your specific areas of interest, and your professional objectives. Writing Sample: Submit a 10-15 page writing sample that demonstrates your ability to conduct research and to analyze literary or cultural texts. Letters of Recommendation: Solicit three letters of recommendation from former professors who are well-acquainted with your academic work. Transcripts: Submit one official transcript from each college or university you have attended.

A complete application to the K-State Graduate School will include: Online application with fee; Official transcripts; Official GRE scores (Verbal and Quantitative); Official TOEFL, IELTS or PTE scores (for international students); Three (3) letters of recommendation; A one to two-page statement of objectives; A curriculum vitae (CV) or resume.

A completed Kansas State University Graduate School application.
Official transcripts of all previous academic work.
The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) general test is not required.
A statement of objectives (not to exceed 1,000 words). The statement should address the following:
- Why you are interested in the Ph.D. in Environmental Design and Planning program at Kansas State University
- Your research interests and how your interest would align with the research expertise of our faculty
- Your career goals after you have earned the Ph.D. degree
A current resume or curriculum vitae.
A writing sample, an example of scholarly work (e.g., master's thesis or report, juried paper, professional report). The writing sample must be submitted in English.
Three letters of reference from individuals who know you and your academic work.

To be admitted to the environmental engineering program, the applicant must have a B.S. in engineering from an ABET-accredited program, or a B.S. in a related area such as chemistry, biology, geology or physics. Students who do not have a B.S. degree in engineering may be required to take some undergraduate courses to remove deficiencies. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale in the junior and senior years is required. An applicant who does not meet this requirement may be admitted on probation.

All applicants must complete the K-State Graduate School's Online Application. Application materials required by the EEOB Graduate Program should be uploaded with your online application. These materials include: unofficial transcripts from each college or university attended, three letters of recommendation, a statement of purpose/letter of intent, and a CV/resume. Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. The GRE General Test is optional for admission.

Admission to the master's program is granted to those with high promise for success in graduate study. Applicants are evaluated based on their undergraduate GPA, letters of reference, statement of purpose, resume, and for international applicants, English proficiency.

Application materials needed:

Kansas State University Graduate School application
Transcripts showing a minimum 3.0 GPA on the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework
Resume
Statement of purpose
Three letters of reference
International students must meet the English proficiency requirements set by the Graduate School.

To be considered for admission, applicants must have:

a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution
a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher for the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework

A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution.
A minimum 3.0 GPA on the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework.
Foundational knowledge in personal finance, counseling and/or financial planning demonstrated by a bachelor's or master's degree or professional experience in one of these fields or a related field.
Successful completion of PFP 762 Introduction to Financial Therapy (available through K-State) with a grade of B or better.
A TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) score of 550 (paper), 213 (computer) or 79 (IBT) is required for applicants whose native language is not English. Applicants with a score between 79-99 on the IBT test may be required to complete English proficiency coursework in their first semester. The score must be from a test administered within the last two years.

• A bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited university with a minimum 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale. The GPA is based on the last 60 hours of the student's undergraduate coursework.
• A student with a GPA between 2.65 and 2.99 may be considered for provisional admission based on an evaluation of their application materials.
• Prerequisite coursework is required in general biology with a lab and general chemistry with a lab. One of the following is also required: microbiology with lab, organic chemistry with lab or biochemistry with lab.
• The GRE is not required.
• For international students, an official report of English proficiency is required.

To apply to the Food Science graduate program, please follow the steps listed on the Graduate School website. The following documents are required for the application:

- A one-page statement of objectives: This statement should include your background, interests, and career goals. Explain why you want to purse a graduate degree in Food Science at Kansas State University.
- A current resume or curriculum vitae.
- Three letters of recommendation: Letters of recommendation must be submitted through the application system. Enter the name and email address for each reference. An email request will be sent to the reference with instructions on how to submit their letter.
- Official transcripts: From each college or university attended.
- Official TOEFL, IELTS or PTE scores (for international students).
- GRE Scores: The GRE is not required for the MS or PhD programs.

Required application materials for the GWSS Graduate Certificate Program include: a Graduate School application, transcripts from all colleges or universities attended, a one-page statement of purpose explaining your interest in the program and how it fits into your academic and/or professional goals, and a writing sample (a recent academic paper is preferred). Applicants should have a minimum 3.0 GPA in the last 60 hours of their undergraduate coursework.

A bachelor's degree with a grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 or better on a 4.0 scale. Courses in general biology, genetics, organic chemistry and calculus are required. Additional courses in biochemistry, cell biology, molecular biology, quantitative genetics and statistics are recommended.

Required application materials: An official transcript from each college or university attended. Three letters of recommendation. A statement of objectives. A curriculum vitae (CV) or resume. A writing sample. Official TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE scores are required for all students whose native language is not English. The GRE test is not required for admission to the Geography graduate program.

A bachelor's degree in geology or a closely related field is required. Students without a B.S. in geology may be required to make up undergraduate deficiencies as determined by the graduate faculty. A minimum GPA of 3.0 in the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework is required.

The following are required for admission to the gerontology master’s program:

A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.
A cumulative undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher (on a 4.0 scale).
Statement of objectives: a one- to two-page statement addressing your career goals and how a master's degree in gerontology will help you achieve them. In addition, discuss any experiences with older adults that have contributed to your interest in gerontology.
Official transcripts from each college or university attended.
Three letters of reference from individuals familiar with your academic or professional capabilities. Letters from academic sources are preferred, but professional sources are acceptable.
A résumé.
A completed online application to the K-State Graduate School.
International students must meet the graduate school's English proficiency requirements.

To be considered for admission, all applicants must submit an online application to the K-State Graduate School. The following application materials must be uploaded with the online application: Application form, Application fee, Official transcripts, Statement of Objectives, Three letters of recommendation, Resume or curriculum vitae. GRE scores are not required for admission to the Grain Science graduate program. For international applicants, English proficiency scores are required.

Students can be admitted to the certificate program upon admission to K-State. Students must have completed 24 hours of college credit and have a minimum GPA of 2.0.

Admission Requirements:
Complete the online application.
Pay the application fee.
Submit official transcripts from each college or university attended.
Non-native English speakers must meet the university's English proficiency requirements.

The Graduate School application form; A non-refundable application fee; One official transcript from each college or university attended; A statement of objectives (approximately 500 words) describing your reasons for pursuing graduate study in history at Kansas State University; Three letters of recommendation from former professors who are in a position to judge the applicant's ability to succeed in graduate school. These should be submitted online as part of the application process; A writing sample, preferably a research paper based on primary sources that is at least ten pages long; A personal resume or curriculum vitae. International students must meet English proficiency requirements as set by the Graduate School. We do not require the GRE for admission to our M.A. or Ph.D. programs.

A bachelor's degree from a college or university accredited by the cognizant regional accrediting agency.
A cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework.
Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores are not required.

Admission requirements include:

*   a bachelor’s degree with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher
*   transcripts from each college or university attended
*   a statement of objectives
*   three letters of reference
*   a resume or curriculum vitae
Program name: Horticulture with an emphasis in Urban Food Systems

Requirements: Application form; Application fee; Official transcripts; Statement of Objectives: a one- to two-page statement of objectives for pursuing graduate study, career goals, and reasons for applying to the graduate program in Hospitality Administration at Kansas State University; Three letters of recommendation; Curriculum Vitae or Resume; English proficiency test scores (TOEFL, IELTS, PTE) may be required for applicants whose native language is not English. See the Graduate School's requirements for English proficiency.; GRE Scores: The GRE is not required for Fall 2024 admissions.

Applicants must have a bachelor's degree with a minimum 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale. Applicants with a GPA lower than 3.0 may be considered for provisional admission if they have a strong academic record in their last 60 hours of coursework, strong letters of reference or a high GRE score.

A statement of objectives is required as part of the application. The statement of objectives should explain why you are applying to the human-computer interaction graduate certificate program, what you hope to gain from the program and how the program fits into your career goals. Your statement of objectives should be one to two pages in length.

Two letters of recommendation are required.

The GRE is not required for admission to this certificate program.

A curriculum vitae or resume is required.

All application materials are submitted online through the Graduate School application process. A complete application consists of: Online application, Application fee, Transcripts, Three letters of recommendation, Statement of objectives, Vita or resume. GRE is NOT required for admission to the IMSE graduate program.

A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution and a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale. Transcripts of all previous academic work. A statement of objectives. Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can attest to your academic potential. A resume or curriculum vita. For international students, a financial affidavit and TOEFL, IELTS or PTE scores are required.

A complete application to the computer science graduate certificate program consists of the following: An online application. Transcripts of all previous college coursework. Application fee. Statement of objectives. Three letters of recommendation. Resume. Requirements for admission: A bachelor's degree in computer science or a closely-related field. An undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Proficiency in an object-oriented programming language, such as C++ or Java. For applicants whose native language is not English, a minimum TOEFL score of 550 (paper-based) or 79 (internet-based), or a minimum IELTS score of 6.5.

Application to the Graduate School; Official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended; A bachelor’s degree with a minimum 3.0 GPA in the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework; A current resume; A letter of interest that highlights your personal and professional goals and your reasons for applying to the program; Three letters of reference; For non-native English speakers, an official TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE score report is required.

Application for admission should be made to the Graduate School at Kansas State University. Application materials must be submitted online through the Graduate School's application portal. To be considered for admission, applicants must submit the following materials:

A completed Graduate School application form.
Official transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities.
Three letters of recommendation.
A one to two-page statement outlining your interest in the program and your career goals.
Portfolio of creative work.
Evidence of English proficiency (international students only).
Resume.

A 3.0 or higher GPA on the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework is required for full admission. The IAPD Department requires the following documents be uploaded with your application to the K-State Graduate School: Letter of intent, Resume or Curriculum Vitae, Portfolio, Official Transcripts, Three letters of recommendation. The IAPD department does not require the GRE.

Undergraduate degree from an accredited institution; Undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher in last 60 hours; Official transcripts; Three letters of recommendation; Statement of objectives (required); Resume (optional); Writing sample (required); For international students, a TOEFL or IELTS score is required. See the Graduate School's requirements for English proficiency.

Completed bachelor’s degree from an accredited university
Minimum 3.0 GPA in the last 60 hours of coursework.
Completed K-State Graduate School Application.
Three letters of recommendation: one from a current or most recent supervising administrator and two from other professionals who can attest to the applicant's leadership abilities.
Statement of goals and professional experience: please follow the prompt in the graduate school application.
Official transcripts from each institution from which a degree was granted.
Interview with program faculty.

A completed Graduate School application and application fee are required. A one-to-two-page statement of objectives outlining your career goals, research interests, and a list of faculty members you are interested in working with is a required component of the application. Three letters of recommendation are required from individuals who can comment on your potential for graduate study. One official transcript is required from each college or university attended where you earned 9 or more credit hours. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale during the last two years of undergraduate study is required. A resume or curriculum vita must be uploaded with your application. Official GRE scores are not required for Fall 2024 admissions.

Go to the K-State Graduate School Website and fill out an online application. You will be asked for the following information to be uploaded to your application:

1. Official academic transcripts of all previous college/university coursework. We require a minimum 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale during the last two years of undergraduate study.

2. Three letters of reference. We prefer letters from former professors or others who can comment on your academic and creative abilities.

3. Statement of intent. This statement is a narrative of your background, and goals for entering the landscape architecture program (no more than two pages).

4. Resume or curriculum vitae (no more than two pages).

5. Digital Portfolio. The portfolio can include any creative works such as drawing, painting, sculpture, graphic design, photography, etc., and should be no more than twenty pages in length. Please submit the portfolio as a single PDF file of 10 MB or less.

6. Application fee.

A Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required for admission to our graduate programs.

International students must have a TOEFL score of 550 (paper-based) or 79 (internet-based) or higher.

Prerequisites: A master's degree in a relevant field from an accredited institution. Applicants must have an undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale and a graduate GPA of 3.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale.
Application Materials:
- Statement of purpose
- Current curriculum vita or resume
- Writing sample: a sample of scholarly writing (e.g. master’s thesis, conference paper, or course paper) no more than 30 pages in length, demonstrating capacity for graduate level academic writing.
- Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions
- Three letters of recommendation from individuals such as faculty or supervisors who can speak to your academic potential and leadership experience.
- Official Graduate Record Exam (GRE) scores (optional)
- English proficiency test scores for applicants whose native language is not English
- Application for admission and application fee

Application requirements include an earned master's degree from an accredited institution. Applicants must have earned at least a 3.0 grade point average on a 4.0 scale. Application materials should include a current resume or vitae, statement of objectives, writing sample, official transcripts, and three letters of recommendation.

- Statement of Objectives: a two-page, single-spaced statement describing your professional goals, purpose in pursuing a Ph.D. in leadership communication, and a description of your research interests as they align with the research interests of our faculty.
- Writing sample: this sample may be a course paper, professional paper, or publication that represents your best scholarly writing.
- Three letters of recommendation: these letters should be from individuals who can speak to your ability to succeed in a doctoral program.

The admission criteria below are the minimum requirements for the Interdepartmental Ph.D. program in life sciences. Students should check the specific admission criteria for the department and major professor they wish to join. Most departments will have higher standards than those set by the Interdepartmental program.

- A bachelor's degree in a biological science with an extensive background in physical science and mathematics.
- A cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
- A major professor who has a graduate faculty appointment in one of the cooperating departments.
- GRE scores are not required for admission into the Life Sciences Ph.D. Program.
- Three letters of recommendation.
- A statement of objectives.

To be considered for this certificate program, applicants must have:

* a bachelor's degree
* a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework
* official transcripts from each institution attended
* three letters of recommendation
* a statement of goals and professional experience

Applications to the Ph.D. program in Mass Communications are made through the Graduate School at Kansas State University. All materials must be submitted with your online application.

The application deadline is December 1 for Fall semester admission.

A complete application consists of the following:
- Graduate School application form
- Application fee
- Official transcripts from each college or university attended, sent directly from the institutions to the K-State Graduate School
- Resume or curriculum vita
- Statement of objectives. This two- to three-page, single-spaced essay should describe your academic and professional background, your reasons for pursuing a Ph.D. in mass communications, and your professional goals.
- Three letters of recommendation from individuals familiar with your academic and/or professional work.
- Writing sample that demonstrates your ability to conduct research and write a scholarly paper. This typically is a master's thesis, a paper written for a graduate-level course, or a paper presented at a scholarly conference.
- Official GRE scores (Verbal, Quantitative, and Analytical Writing) are optional for Fall 2024 applications. Our institution code is 6334; no department code is needed.

Applicants for the graduate program should have completed, with an average grade of B or better, at least 18 semester hours of post-calculus mathematics. These courses should include one semester of linear algebra and one semester of either advanced calculus or real analysis.

For admission to the master of science degree program, the student must have completed a B.S. degree program in mechanical engineering or a closely related field from an ABET-accredited institution with an undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0/4.0. For admission to the doctor of philosophy degree program, the student must have completed a M.S. degree in mechanical engineering or a closely related field, and maintained a graduate GPA of at least 3.5/5.0. The following items must be submitted to the K-State Graduate School through the online application system: A statement of objectives, Three letters of recommendation, Transcripts, Resume or curriculum vitae, A pre-application form. GRE scores are not required for M.S. and Ph.D. domestic and international applications.

The application and all supporting documents must be submitted online by December 1 for Fall semester admission. Our program does not offer Spring semester admission. You must submit all of the following: One unofficial transcript from each college or university attended. Unofficial transcripts should be uploaded as part of the online application. Students who are admitted will be required to submit an official transcript from the institution that conferred their bachelor's degree (and master's degree, if applicable) to the Graduate School. Graduate School application. Statement of objectives: A one to two page statement of your academic objectives, research interests and experiences, and career goals. Curriculum vitae or resume. Three letters of recommendation. You will be asked to enter the names and email addresses of your references in the online application. An email will be sent to your references with instructions on how to submit their letters electronically. Letters of recommendation should be written by persons who are familiar with your academic and research abilities and potential for success in a graduate program. The GRE General Test is not required for admission to the Graduate Program in Biology.

To be considered for admission, applicants must submit the following materials:
- Statement of purpose
- Writing sample in the language of graduate study
- Three letters of recommendation
- Resume (or curriculum vitae)
- Graduate School application form
- One official transcript from each college or university attended
- Application fee
- TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE scores for international students

Minimum admission requirements:
- A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.
- A minimum 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale during the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework.
- For the specialization in French, Spanish, or German: A B.A. or B.S. in the language of specialization or a related field, with a minimum of 20 semester credit hours of upper-division work in the target language.
- For the specialization in Second Language Acquisition (with an emphasis in French, German, or Spanish): A B.A. or B.S. in the language of emphasis or a related field, with a minimum of 20 semester credit hours of upper-division work in the target language; or evidence of advanced-level proficiency as defined by the ACTFL Proficiency Guidelines.
- For applicants who are not native speakers of English: A minimum TOEFL score of 79 on the iBT (internet-based test) or 550 on the PBT (paper-based test); a minimum IELTS score of 6.5; or a minimum PTE score of 58.

Admission to the Master of Music program requires: An undergraduate degree in music from an accredited institution with a grade point average qualifying the student for full admission to the Graduate School (a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale during the last 60 hours of undergraduate study). Successful completion of an audition or interview. The following materials must be uploaded to your Graduate School Application: Statement of objectives (1-2 pages describing your background and goals); Contact information for three references. These individuals will be contacted to submit letters of recommendation on your behalf; A curriculum vita or resume; A scholarly writing sample (for musicology and music theory applicants only).

A B.S. degree in mechanical or nuclear engineering or a closely related field from an ABET-accredited program, or equivalent. A minimum GPA of 3.0/4.0 in the B.S. degree. The GRE is not required for any MNE graduate programs. Your completed application package must contain: Statement of objectives, Three letters of recommendation, Resume, Transcripts from all previous institutions.

The following materials must be submitted as part of the online application: Application form and fee; One official transcript from each college or university attended where a degree was granted. If you are still in a degree program, a transcript with at least six semesters of coursework is required for admission review. A final transcript will be required after graduation. Three letters of recommendation from persons qualified to assess the student's academic and professional capabilities. It is preferred that two of the letters be from former professors. Letter of intent/Statement of purpose: A one- to two-page letter detailing the applicant's professional goals and reasons for pursuing a graduate degree in the selected area of specialization. It is recommended that applicants indicate one or more specific graduate faculty with whom they are interested in working. Resume or Curriculum Vitae; GRE Scores (optional): GRE scores are not required but can be submitted as an option to strengthen an applicant's profile.

The IMSE graduate faculty consider a number of factors when reviewing an application for admission, including: a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution; undergraduate academic performance as reflected by the grade point average (GPA); scores on the graduate record examination (GRE); for international applicants, scores on the test of English as a foreign language (TOEFL) or international English language testing system (IELTS); letters of recommendation; the applicant's statement of objectives; and other factors such as relevant work experience, research experience and publications.

Required application documents include:
Statement of objectives/letter of intent describing your background, interests, and career goals.
Three letters of reference.
Curriculum vitae or resume.
Transcripts of all previous college/university work.
GRE scores are not required for admission to the Pathobiology Ph.D. program.
International students must also provide official TOEFL/IELTS/PTE scores and a Financial Affidavit.

For the M.S. degree, application materials include: A completed online application. A GPA of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 hours of coursework is required for full admission. Statement of goals and objectives: one-to-two-page statement outlining your career goals and how a graduate degree from K-State will help you achieve them. Resume or curriculum vita. Three letters of recommendation. One official transcript from each college or university attended. GRE test scores are not required. For international students, TOEFL, IELTS or PTE scores are required if you do not meet the English proficiency requirements outlined by the Graduate School. The Ph.D. program has similar requirements but also requires a writing sample and GRE test scores.

An undergraduate degree in a science, agriculture or engineering discipline from an accredited institution. Consideration will be given to applicants with degrees in other fields who have taken appropriate science coursework (biology, chemistry, physics, etc.) and/or have relevant industry experience.

A minimum 3.0 GPA in the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework.

This certificate program is a stand-alone, non-degree-seeking graduate certificate. It can be taken by both students pursuing a graduate degree and non-degree seeking working professionals. There is not a GRE requirement for this certificate program.

A TOEFL score of 550 (paper) or 79 (iBT) is required for international students whose native language is not English.

Prospective students should complete the Graduate School Application Form. We also require the following to be uploaded to your online application:

- Statement of purpose
- Writing sample (e.g., term paper)
- Three letters of recommendation
- Official transcripts
- For international students whose native language is not English, TOEFL or IELTS scores are required.

Please have all materials submitted by January 15th to receive full consideration for admission with financial support, and by March 1st for admission only.

In most cases, we do not require the GRE for admission.

Application for admission
Application fee
One official transcript from each college or university attended
Three letters of recommendation
Statement of objectives
Resume/CV

All applications must be submitted online through the Graduate School's application portal. A complete application consists of the following items, which must be uploaded directly to the application portal: 1. Statement of Objectives; 2. Three letters of recommendation; 3. Transcripts; 4. GRE scores (Physics subject test recommended but not required); 5. TOEFL or IELTS scores (for non-native English speakers only).

To be admitted to the Graduate Program in Physiological Sciences, an applicant must have a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution and meet the general admission requirements of the Graduate School. The application requires: Transcripts, Three letters of reference, A statement of interest/personal statement, A resume or CV, Application fee, TOEFL scores (if applicable). In addition, the following are generally expected: A grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale. A strong background in the biological and physical sciences, including biology, chemistry, physics, and mathematics. Research experience (highly desirable for Ph.D. program applicants). For international applicants whose native language is not English, a minimum TOEFL score of 550 (paper-based), 213 (computer-based), or 79 (internet-based) is required.

In addition to the Graduate School’s required documentation, the Plant Pathology Graduate Program also requires the following:

Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can evaluate the applicant’s potential for graduate study.
Statement of objectives. Describe your academic and career goals, your research interests and experience, and the reasons for pursuing an advanced degree in plant pathology at Kansas State University.
Curriculum vitae (CV) or resume detailing your academic background, honors, and work experience.
Unofficial transcripts for all post-secondary education.
Official GRE scores are not required for admission to the plant pathology graduate program.

A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.
A grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale for the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework.
International applicants must also meet the English proficiency requirements of the Graduate School.

Admission to the PSM program is granted by the PSM advisory board. Applicants must meet the requirements of the Graduate School and have an undergraduate degree in life sciences, math, engineering, business, or economics. Application materials: Graduate School application, Official transcripts, Three letters of reference, A one- to two-page statement of objectives describing your career goals and how the PSM program will help you achieve them, Resume. GRE scores are not required. TOEFL, IELTS or PTE scores are required for non-native English speakers.

Applications for graduate study are accepted for fall admissions only. The deadline for all applications for fall admissions is December 1. Applications must be submitted online through the Graduate School's application portal. To be considered for admission, you must submit the following materials: Graduate School Application, Application Fee, Statement of Purpose (limit 1000 words), Three Letters of Recommendation, Transcripts from each college or university attended, a current vita or resume. The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required for admission. A writing sample is optional.

The following are required for admission to the MPA program: An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 hours of coursework. In addition, the following must be submitted as part of your application: Graduate School application form; Application fee; One official transcript from each college or university attended; Three letters of reference; A statement of objectives; A resume or curriculum vitae (CV). The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required for admission into the MPA program.

Kansas State University uses a test-optional admissions process. Students with a 3.25 or higher high school GPA will be automatically admitted to K-State. Students with a GPA between 2.0 and 3.24 will have their application reviewed on a holistic basis. Test scores will not be part of this review process.

A bachelor’s degree with a 3.0 GPA or higher on a 4.0 scale for the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework is required. In addition, you will be required to submit:

- official transcripts from each institution attended
- three letters of recommendation
- a one- to two-page statement of goals and objectives
- a resume or curriculum vitae

Bachelor's degree from a college or university accredited by the cognized regional accrediting agency. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale in the last 60 hours of study. A student who has the required GPA, but whose bachelor's degree is in a discipline other than horticulture or a closely related field of plant science, may be admitted on a provisional basis. It is generally recommended that students have completed coursework in botany, chemistry, soils, and math.

All application materials must be submitted to the K-State Graduate School. Three letters of recommendation. Statement of objectives. Transcripts from all previous institutions attended. Resume. TOEFL scores for international students.

Graduate School Application, Official transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities, A statement of objectives, Contact information for three references, A sample of writing, GRE test scores are optional for all applicants, Resume (optional).

Admission Requirements:
- A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution.
- A cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale during the last 60 hours of their undergraduate coursework.
- Successful completion of a background check (upon admission).

Application Materials:
- Graduate School Application
- Application Fee
- Official Transcripts
- Three letters of recommendation
- Statement of goals and professional experience (statement of purpose)
- Resume/Vita
- A 3-5 minute video recording responding to a provided prompt.

Complete the K-State Graduate School Application.
Pay the application fee.
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a 3.0 GPA in the last 60 hours of coursework.
Official transcripts from all institutions attended.
Three letters of recommendation.
A Professional Statement.
Interview with program faculty.
Program specific prerequisite content courses with a grade of C or better and a minimum GPA of 2.75 in those courses.
Passing score on the content assessment required for your teaching area prior to admission.

Application requirements include: A completed K-State Graduate School application. Official transcripts showing a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution with a minimum 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale for the last 60 hours of coursework. A personal statement of interest (no more than 500 words). Three letters of recommendation. Resume or curriculum vitae (CV). Official GRE scores are NOT required for applicants with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale on their bachelor's degree. For applicants who do not meet this requirement, the Security Studies program requires a combined minimum score of 300 on the GRE Verbal and Quantitative Reasoning sections and a minimum score of 4.0 on the GRE Analytical Writing section. English proficiency scores (if applicable). A writing sample is NOT required.

A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.
A minimum 3.0 GPA on the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework.
A current resume or curriculum vita.
A statement of goals and objectives that is one-to-two pages in length, double-spaced. This statement should explain the applicant's reasons for pursuing the social justice education graduate certificate at K-State.
Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can attest to the applicant's capacity for graduate-level work and commitment to social justice.
Transcripts from each institution attended.
A writing sample. Examples include a paper completed in a previous course, a published article or a report prepared for a community or professional organization.

Admission to the MSW program is competitive. All applicants must meet the following minimum requirements to be considered:
1. Baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution.
2. A grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale in the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework. Applicants with a GPA lower than 3.0 must provide a written statement explaining the circumstances.
3. An undergraduate liberal arts background that includes coursework in the following areas: English composition, humanities, biological sciences, social sciences and statistics.
4. For Advanced Standing applicants only: A Bachelor of Social Work (BSW) degree from a Council on Social Work Education (CSWE) accredited program within the last five years and a 3.0 GPA in all social work coursework.
5. International applicants must also meet the Graduate School's English proficiency requirements.

A complete application to the Sociology Graduate Program at Kansas State University includes:

A one-to-two-page statement of purpose that describes your academic interests and career goals. We are particularly interested in learning about why you want to pursue a graduate degree in sociology and what research questions you would be interested in pursuing in graduate school. You are welcome to describe your interest in working with particular faculty members in our department.
A sample of your written work (e.g., an undergraduate paper).
A current resume or vita.
Three letters of recommendation from individuals familiar with your academic work (e.g., former professors).
Official transcripts from all colleges and universities that you have attended.
Official Graduate Record Exam (GRE) scores are not required.
An application fee.
For international students, TOEFL scores are required (a minimum score of 79 on the iBT is required for admission, and a minimum score of 22 on the speaking portion of the iBT is required to be eligible for a Graduate Teaching Assistantship).

An undergraduate degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related area from a college or university accredited by a regional accrediting agency recognized by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation. An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale is required for admission. GRE is not required for admission. If you do not meet the minimum GPA requirement, you should include additional information in your application to help the admissions committee assess your potential for success in the program. Applicants who are non-native English speakers must demonstrate English proficiency.

Applications are reviewed holistically, with emphasis placed on fit with the program mission and goals. Admission to the program is contingent upon admission to the Graduate School. Meeting minimum requirements for admission to the Graduate School does not guarantee admission into the program.

Requirements:

A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution.
An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher during the last 60 hours of credit.

To apply to the Department of Statistics at Kansas State University, you must submit the following materials:
1. Online Application: Complete the online application through the Graduate School.
2. Application Fee: A non-refundable fee is required for each application. For information on the application fee and available waivers, please see the Graduate School's website.
3. Transcripts: One unofficial transcript from each college or university where you received a bachelor's degree or higher must be uploaded as part of the online application. If you are admitted, you must submit an official transcript. If your transcript is not in English, you must provide an official translation of the transcript.
4. English Proficiency: If you are a non-native English speaker, you must demonstrate English proficiency. For the University's requirements, please see the Graduate School's website.
5. GRE scores: GRE scores (quantitative, verbal, and analytical writing) are optional. However, if you are seeking a Graduate Teaching Assistantship (GTA) and have GRE scores, they must be sent to the Graduate School. GRE scores are not required to be considered for a GTA. The K-State institution code is 6334. The Department code is 0705.
6. Letters of Recommendation: Three letters of recommendation from persons qualified to assess your academic background and potential for graduate study. Your recommenders will be notified by email and will be asked to submit their letters online.
7. Statement of Purpose: A one-to-two-page statement of objectives, which should explain your purpose in pursuing a graduate degree in statistics, your career goals, and your particular interest in our department. You will be asked to upload your statement of purpose as part of the online application.
8. Resume/CV: A resume or curriculum vitae.

Admission Criteria

Hold a master's degree from an accredited university.
Have a minimum 3.25 grade point average (GPA) on a 4.0 scale in master's degree coursework.
Have relevant professional experience in student affairs in higher education or a related field.
Submit a completed online application to the K-State Graduate School.

Application Materials

Graduate School application form
Graduate School application fee
One official transcript from each college or university attended
Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can comment on your potential for success in a doctoral program.
A personal statement that describes: (a) your professional goals; (b) how the Ph.D. in student affairs in higher education at K-State will help you meet your goals; (c) a summary of your professional experiences in higher education; and (d) your research interests. The statement should be 3-5 pages, double-spaced.
A current résumé or curriculum vitae (CV).
A writing sample that demonstrates your writing and analytical skills. This may be a paper written for a master's level course or a professional report.
The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required.

GPA of 3.0 in last 60 hours of coursework; Three letters of recommendation; Statement of purpose; Transcripts from all previous institutions; Complete and pass the Praxis Core Academic Skills for Educators exam; A bachelor's degree in an endorsable area (or completion of 24 credit hours in the subject area) from a regionally accredited institution; Pass the appropriate Praxis II Subject Assessment; Interview with the M.A.T. advisory committee; Background check.

Master’s degree, Minimum 3.25 GPA on a 4.0 scale, Three years of successful teaching experience, Resume or curriculum vita, Three letters of recommendation, Statement of goals and professional experience. For non-native English speakers, an English proficiency test score is required. A minimum TOEFL score of 577 (pBT) or 90 (iBT), a minimum IELTS score of 7.0, or a minimum PTE score of 61 is required.

Minimum 3.0 GPA in the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework. The following items are needed to complete the online application: Unofficial transcripts from each institution attended; A one- to two-page statement of objectives; Contact information for three references; $65 domestic application fee or $75 international application fee.
Program name: Teaching English as a Second Language

Requirements: Applicants must have a completed baccalaureate degree from an accredited institution. A grade point average of 3.0 (B) or better in the last 60 hours of undergraduate study. Students not meeting this requirement may be admitted on probation. Applicants must be approved by the graduate faculty in theatre. Applicants must submit the following materials to the Graduate School: Three letters of recommendation. A written statement of purpose describing the applicant's background and goals for graduate study. A resume. An interview is required of all applicants under serious consideration. Interviews may be conducted by phone or video conference.

A statement of objectives (approximately 1 page single spaced) addressing the following: your academic and research background; your research interest(s) and how it fits into the graduate program; your career goals and how a graduate degree will help you achieve them.
A curriculum vitae or resume.
Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can assess your academic potential for graduate school.
Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
GRE is not required for admission to this program.
For international applicants, a TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE score is required.

Admission to the veterinary forensics graduate certificate program requires:

a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution (all degrees are considered, however, degrees in science are preferred)
a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework
a completed application

Students for whom English is a second language must meet the minimum English proficiency requirements for graduate students.

An earned bachelor's degree with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 hours of coursework. Official transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities. Three letters of recommendation. A statement of objectives. A resume or curriculum vitae. International students must also demonstrate English proficiency. The MPH program does not require the Graduate Record Examination (GRE).

A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.
A grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale for the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework.
Complete the K-State Graduate School application.
Official transcripts from each college or university attended.
A one- to two-page statement of objectives.
Three letters of recommendation.
A resume or curriculum vitae (CV).
A sample of professional writing (academic papers, newsletters, curriculum and other similar documents are accepted).
For international students, a TOEFL score of 550 (paper) or 79 (internet).

To be admitted into the program, applicants must meet the K-State Graduate School requirements. A bachelor’s degree from a college or university accredited by the cognizant regional accrediting agency is required. In addition, an undergraduate grade point average of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 hours of coursework is required for full admission. Applicants must also complete the online application and submit all supplemental materials: Official transcripts, One-page personal statement of career and professional goals, Three letters of recommendation, Resume.
